intro: Lepanthes divaricata, commonly known as the Variable Orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant grows as an epiphyte, often found on trees in humid, tropical environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Lepanthes divaricata is appreciated for its ornamental value and is cultivated by orchid enthusiasts for its unique floral structure.
